title: Does Sorcery Mastery Work With toxic shot damage
body: Does Sorcery Mastery Work With toxic shot damage

The description for sorcery says "ability damage" (not "spell damage") and the wiki says:

"Damage amplification applies to all active abilities. Including the bonus damage from activated autoattack enhanced abilities and abilities that apply on-hit effects."

So it sounds like Teemo's poison SHOULD be procing it. Because it's not just spell damage. It's ABILITIES and spell damage. The mastery sounds like it's supposed to be a special case that makes your "abilities" stronger, regardless of what kind of damage they do or effects they trigger.

Mechanically, "ability" and "spell" have very specific meanings. "Ability" does not mean "innate, Q, W, E, and R". "Abilities" are things that apply spell effects, which effectively boils down to moves/skills (what I use to refer to innateQWER) that aren't on-hit effects and moves/skills that don't apply on-hit effects. There are a few exceptions, but let's keep it simple. "Spells" are abilities, plus summoner spells and item actives.

Teemo's E is an on-hit effect, and, therefore, not an ability.
